title: Kalman Filtering and State Estimation
description: Kalman filtering provides optimal state estimation for linear dynamical systems with Gaussian noise, serving as a foundation for recursive Bayesian estimation.
learning_objectives: Understand the Kalman filter as optimal linear estimator
Implement Kalman filtering for state estimation problems
Apply Kalman filtering to control and navigation problems
Connect Kalman filtering to Active Inference

content.overview: The Kalman filter is an optimal recursive algorithm for estimating the state of a linear dynamical system from noisy measurements. It provides the best linear unbiased estimate of the hidden state, making it fundamental to modern control theory, navigation, and signal processing.

problem_formulation.state_evolution: x_t = A x_{t-1} + B u_t + w_t

prediction_step: State prediction: x̂_t|t-1 = A x̂_t-1|t-1 + B u_t
Covariance prediction: P_t|t-1 = A P_t-1|t-1 Aᵀ + Q
update_step: Innovation covariance: S_t = C P_t|t-1 Cᵀ + R
Kalman gain: K_t = P_t|t-1 Cᵀ S_t⁻¹
State update: x̂_t|t = x̂_t|t-1 + K_t ỹ_t
Covariance update: P_t|t = (I - K_t C) P_t|t-1

optimality_properties.minimum_variance: Minimizes trace of estimation error covariance
optimality_properties.unbiased_estimate: Expected value of estimation error is zero
optimality_properties.recursive_computation: Updates estimate using only previous estimate and new data

extensions_and_variants.ensemble_kalman_filter: Monte Carlo approximation for high dimensions

connection_to_active_inference.belief_updating: Kalman filter as continuous belief updating

common_misconceptions.misconception: Kalman filter works for any nonlinear system
common_misconceptions.clarification: Extended and unscented versions handle nonlinearity approximately

common_misconceptions.misconception: Kalman filter is a low-pass filter
common_misconceptions.clarification: It's an optimal estimator, not just a smoothing filter
Depends on measurement quality and correlation with state
